description.onSleepDisable: If sleep mode is inactive, set this brightness value directly when SteamVR or OyasumiVR starts.

brightnessAutomations.description: Have OyasumiVR automatically adjust the brightness of your VR headset at various times, like when you go to sleep, or when you wake up.

sleepPreparation.description: You can prepare to go to sleep by pressing a button in OyasumiVR's overlay. The button for this will be shown when you have one or more sleep preparation automations active, like this one. Use this to already start dimming the brightness before you fall asleep.
sleepPreparation.title: Sleep Preparation

transition.description: Smoothly transition to your desired brightness value
transition.title: Adjust brightness gradually

transitionTime.description: How long it should take to transition to the new brightness setting
transitionTime.title: Transition time

modeInfoModal.message:
By default, OyasumiVR will control the brightness of your VR headset by adjusting the brightness of the image. If you're using a headset with a LCD panel that can have its backlight controlled through SteamVR (e.g. the Valve Index), OyasumiVR will control the display brightness instead whenever possible.

In simple mode, OyasumiVR will smoothly transition between controlling image brightness and display brightness.

In case you prefer direct control, advanced mode allows you to control both image- and display brightness separate from each other, and allows you to set exact brightness values for each.

This only applies to headsets that support this, which currently only consists of the Valve Index. On other VR headsets, there is no difference between simple and advanced mode.
modeInfoModal.title: Brightness Control Mode

chaperone-automations.description: OyasumiVR can automatically adjust the fade distance of SteamVR's chaperone when sleep mode is enabled or disabled.

disabled.disabled:
OyasumiVR has various ways to automatically tweak your GPU settings.
This allows you to save power while you are asleep.

As this is a feature for advanced users, it is disabled by default.
You can enable it by clicking the button below.
disabled.noSidecar: In order for OyasumiVR to be allowed to change your GPU settings, it requires administrator privileges. Please click the button below to give OyasumiVR administrator privileges.

elevationSidecarModal.message:
Do you want to always give OyasumiVR administrator privileges?

If you enable this, OyasumiVR will immediately ask for them when starting. You can disable this later at any time in the settings.
elevationSidecarModal.title: Give administrator privileges

gpu-automations.enableWarning: Incorrectly tweaking your GPU parameters could lead to your system becoming unstable. Please keep this in mind and only enable this feature if you know what you are doing.

msiAfterburner.description:
OyasumiVR can automatically tweak your GPU settings when you go to sleep or wake up, by applying profiles you've created in MSI Afterburner. A use case for this functionality is to save electricity while you are asleep, and regain GPU power when you wake up.

You have to set up the profiles you want to apply in MSI Afterburner.
You can download MSI Afterburner here.
msiAfterburner.enabledWarning: Please be aware that incorrectly configuring your GPU in MSI Afterburner could result in your system becoming unstable. Disable this feature if you do not know what you are doing.

executable.description: OyasumiVR needs to know about the location of your MSIAfterburner.exe executable. If OyasumiVR cannot find it in the default location, you need to set where it can be found.

status.INVALID_EXECUTABLE: The MSIAfterburner.exe at this location could not be verified as working.
status.INVALID_SIGNATURE: The MSIAfterburner.exe at this location could not be verified to come from MSI. For security reasons it cannot be used. Please make sure you are using the latest version of MSI Afterburner. If the problem persists or you are sure this is correct, please contact OyasumiVR's developer or submit a bug report.
status.NOT_FOUND: The MSIAfterburner.exe could not be found at this location.
status.SUCCESS: MSIAfterburner.exe has been found and is working correctly!
status.UNKNOWN_ERROR: An unknown error occurred while trying to look for MSIAfterburner.exe at this location.

executable.title: Configuration

sleepModeEnable.description: Apply the following MSI Afterburner profile

powerLimiting.description: Here you can automate the power limits of your GPU, to save on electricity while you are asleep. Power limiting is only available for NVIDIA GPUs.

disabled.initializing: Power limiting automations are being initialized...
disabled.noNvidia:
Power limiting automations are unavailable as no running NVIDIA driver was detected. Power limiting automations are only available for NVIDIA GPUs.

If you have an NVIDIA GPU in your system, please ensure that the appropriate driver for it is installed.

({code})
disabled.noPermission:
Although OyasumiVR has administrator privileges, it does not have permission to change your GPU settings.

Please check your system configuration as this should normally never occur.
disabled.noSidecar:
For an unknown reason, administrator privileges could not be obtained.
These are required for controlling your GPU's power limits.

Please try restarting OyasumiVR.
disabled.unknown:
Power limiting automations are unavailable for an unknown reason.

Please try restarting OyasumiVR.

powerLimiting.enabledWarning: Please be aware that setting your power limits too low could result in your system becoming unstable. Disable this feature if you do not know what you are doing.
powerLimiting.gpuPowerLimitsUnsupported: The selected GPU does not support setting power limits.
powerLimiting.inputDefault: Reset to the GPU's default limit.
powerLimiting.noGPUs: No NVIDIA GPUs could be found in your system.
powerLimiting.selectGPU: Select the GPU you wish to set the power limit for:

gpu-automations.title: GPU Automations

misc.GOGO_LOCO_LEGACY_PRESET_WARNING: This preset uses a workaround that has some issues. Please only use this preset if you can't use the newer GoGo Loco preset. If your avatar still uses an older version of GoGo Loco, it is recommended that you update your avatar to use the latest GoGo Loco version.

oscScriptEditorErrors.addressNoSlash: A valid OSC address must always start with a '/' symbol.
oscScriptEditorErrors.addressNotASCII: A valid OSC address must only contain ASCII characters.
oscScriptEditorErrors.durationTooShort: Sleep duration must be at least 1ms.
oscScriptEditorErrors.floatOutOfBounds: The value must be a valid float value between -1.0 and 1.0.
oscScriptEditorErrors.floatTooPrecise: The value can only have a precision of 3 decimals maximum.
oscScriptEditorErrors.intOutOfBounds: The value must be a valid integer between 0 and 255.
oscScriptEditorErrors.noFloatMilliseconds: Millisecond values have to be defined as a whole number.
oscScriptEditorErrors.tooManyCommands: An OSC script cannot have more than {value} actions.
oscScriptEditorErrors.totalDurationTooLong: The total script duration cannot exceed 10 seconds.

sleepCheck.content:
Sleep mode will be enabled in 20 seconds.
Are you asleep?

To cancel:
Shake your head or press any controller button

sleepCheckCancel.content: Automatic enabling of sleep mode has been cancelled

turningOffControllersAndTrackers.content: Turning off both your controllers and your trackers

vrcStatusChangedPlayerCount.content: Your VRChat status has been set to ''{newStatus}''

general.description: Here you can configure OyasumiVR to send out OSC commands to VRChat when certain events happen. This can, for example, be useful if you want to change your avatar toggles when you go to sleep or wake up.

sleepingAnimations.description: OyasumiVR can automatically change your avatar animations when you change sleeping position. This can be useful if you don't have full body tracking, or if you (or you have OyasumiVR) turn off your trackers during the night. See an example of what this could look like here. Presets are available for several pre-made avatar locomotion prefabs, but you can specify your own animations as well.

footLock.description: Set the OSC commands to enable and disable the foot lock.
footLock.title: Foot Lock

footLock.description: A foot lock commonly prevents the player from moving or rotating when it is enabled.
footLock.title: Foot Lock

general.lockFeetOnSleepModeEnable: Lock feet when sleep mode is enabled
general.releaseFootLockOnPoseChange: Momentarily release foot lock when switching sleeping positions
general.title: General Options
general.unlockFeetOnAutomationDisable: Unlock feet when disabling automatic sleeping animations
general.unlockFeetOnSleepModeDisable: Unlock feet when sleep mode is disabled

positions.description: Set the OSC commands to activate the animation for each sleeping position.
positions.title: Sleeping Positions

windowsPowerPolicy.description: OyasumiVR can automatically change the active Windows Power Policy when you go to sleep or wake up. This can be useful to reduce your power consumption while you are asleep, and restore a higher performance policy when you wake up again.

contribute.description: Contribute missing translations, or help add new languages!
contribute.title: Help out by contributing translations

loadFile.description: Load a custom language file. Useful when testing new translations.
loadFile.title: Load translation file

editor.title: Translation Editor
editor.description: Launch OyasumiVR's translation editor for editing and creating translations
editor.experimental: This module is still in an experimental stage, and is available in English only. While you can try it out, it is very much still in development. For now, you can still expect to find issues and missing functionality.

fixes.title: Fixes & Troubleshooting
fixes.description: This section contains some options and actions related to fixing problems and troubleshooting. You generally shouldn't use these unless you know what you are doing, or if you're being asked to use these when getting support.

vrManifestReregister.title: Reregister SteamVR application manifest
vrManifestReregister.description: Reregisters OyasumiVR's VR application manifest with SteamVR.

success.title: VR Application Manifest Reregistered
success.message: OyasumiVR's Manifest has successfully been reregistered with SteamVR.

MANIFEST_ADD_FAILED.title: Reregistration of VR Application Manifest Failed
MANIFEST_ADD_FAILED.message: The manifest was removed, but it could not be added back. Please restart OyasumiVR and check the logs.

MANIFEST_REMOVE_FAILED.title: Reregistration of VR Application Manifest Failed
MANIFEST_REMOVE_FAILED.message: The manifest could not be removed. Please check the logs.

MANIFEST_NOT_REGISTERED.title: Reregistration of VR Application Manifest Failed
MANIFEST_NOT_REGISTERED.message: OyasumiVR's had no manifest registered with SteamVR. It has not been (re)registered. Please restart OyasumiVR.

MANIFEST_CHECK_FAILED.title: Reregistration of VR Application Manifest Failed
MANIFEST_CHECK_FAILED.message: It could not be checked if OyasumiVR's manifest was already registered with SteamVR. Please restart OyasumiVR and check the logs.

FLAVOUR_NOT_ELIGIBLE.title: Application manifest unregistered
FLAVOUR_NOT_ELIGIBLE.message: As you're using a non-eligible build of OyasumiVR (e.g. the Steam version), the application manifest has been unregistered, but not reregistered. This is not an error! Please restart OyasumiVR.

UNKNOWN.title: Reregistration of VR Application Manifest Failed
UNKNOWN.message: OyasumiVR's manifest could not be reregistered with SteamVR due to an unknown error. Please restart OyasumiVR and check the logs.

adminPrivileges.description: OyasumiVR needs administrator privileges to be able to control your GPU's power limits. If you enable this, OyasumiVR will ask for administrator privileges when it starts up.
adminPrivileges.label: Ask for administrator privileges on startup
adminPrivileges.title: Administrator Privileges

language.description: You can select your desired language here. If there are any missing translations, or you would like like to add support for your language, please get in contact!
language.title: Language

lighthouseConsole.description: OyasumiVR needs to know about the location of your SteamVR installation's lighthouse_console.exe. If OyasumiVR cannot find it in the default location, you need to set where it can be found.

status.INVALID_EXECUTABLE: The lighthouse_console.exe at this location could not be verified as working.
status.INVALID_FILENAME: The set location is not a valid file path.
status.NOT_FOUND: The lighthouse_console.exe could not be found at this location.
status.PERMISSION_DENIED: OyasumiVR does not have permission to run the lighthouse_console.exe at this location. Try running OyasumiVR as administrator.
status.SUCCESS: lighthouse_console.exe has been found and is working correctly!
status.UNKNOWN_ERROR: An unknown error occurred while trying to look for lighthouse_console.exe at this location.

lighthouseConsole.title: Lighthouse Console

enable.description: If enabled, you will be able to power your base stations off and on using OyasumiVR. Requires bluetooth, and supports V2 base stations only.
enable.title: Enable power control

powerOffMode.description: Unlike Standby mode, Sleep mode also turns off the motors, which can take longer to turn back on.
powerOffMode.title: Preferred power off state

overlayGpuFix.description: If you are experiencing issues with opening the SteamVR overlay, enabling this option could fix the issue on some systems (e.g. those with hybrid graphics). Changing this option will restart the overlay.
overlayGpuFix.title: Graphics fix for SteamVR Overlay

binding.description: Which button triggers the overlay menu can be configured within SteamVR's binding menu.
binding.title: Controller button binding

overlayMenu.description: This can be turned off if you want to disable OyasumiVR's overlay menu completely.
overlayMenu.title: Enable overlay menu

startupBehaviour.description: What the sleep mode should be when you start OyasumiVR

stopWithSteamVR.description: Quit OyasumiVR when SteamVR is stopped for a certain amount of time

close.description: Closes OyasumiVR to the system tray instead of exiting the program.
close.label: Close to the system tray

start.description: Starts OyasumiVR minimized to the system tray.
start.label: Start in the system tray

telemetry.description: The data that will be sent is limited to the version of OyasumiVR that you are using, and the language you have set. No other data is sent and it is completely anonymous. This data is only used for providing some general usage statistics.
telemetry.label: Send anonymous usage data
telemetry.title: Telemetry

integrations.description: Some of OyasumiVR's functionalities can make use of external services. If you're looking to connect OyasumiVR to one of them, you're in the right place!

pulsoid.description:
Provides your heart rate data to OyasumiVR, which can be used to trigger certain automations.
Requires: Pulsoid "BRO" subscription

vrchat.description: Linking your account provides access to some of OyasumiVR's VRChat-related automations.

AUTO_UPDATED_STATUS_PLAYERCOUNT.description: Get a notification when OyasumiVR has automatically updated your VRChat status

SLEEP_MODE_DISABLED.description: Get a notification when the sleep mode is deactivated

SLEEP_MODE_ENABLED.description: Get a notification when the sleep mode is activated

notifications.description: Select which notifications will and won't be sent

provider.description: Select which provider should be used to deliver notifications to you

volume.description: Set the volume level at which some notification types play their sound

updates.notChecked: OyasumiVR did not check for updates yet.
updates.noUpdate: You are currently running OyasumiVR v{version} which is the latest version!
updates.updateAvailable:
A new version of OyasumiVR is available! You are currently running v{currentVersion}.
The newest version is v{latestVersion}.

updatesDisabled.DEV:
As you are running a development build of OyasumiVR, updates have been disabled.
If you want to install a new(er) version of OyasumiVR, please download and run the installer manually.
updatesDisabled.STEAM:
You have installed the Steam version of OyasumiVR.
New OyasumiVR updates are therefore provided through Steam!

logIn.description: Some OyasumiVR features require you to log in with your VRChat account for them to work.

disclaimers.brand: OyasumiVR isn't endorsed by VRChat and doesn't reflect the views or opinions of VRChat or anyone officially involved in producing or managing VRChat. VRChat is trademark of VRChat Inc. VRChat  VRChat Inc.
disclaimers.liability: Raphiiko is not not responsible for any problems caused by OyasumiVR. Use at your own risk!
disclaimers.use: Your login credentials will never be stored anywhere and are only ever sent to VRChat's servers for authentication purposes.

loggedIn.subtext: You are currently logged in with your VRChat account.
loggedIn.title: Hi {name}!

loggedOut.subtext: You are currently not logged in with your VRChat account.
loggedOut.title: Logged Out

logIn.title: Log in

OSC.description: Some features require connecting to VRChat via OSC. Unless you have a specific reason to change these, you should leave these as default.

errors.INVALID_HOST: The host has to be a valid hostname, IPv4 address, or IPv6 address.
errors.PORT_IN_USE: This address could not be bound. It could be that another application is already using it. You can try to close that application and try again, or choose a different receiving port or host.
errors.PORT_INVALID: A port has to be a valid number between 1 and 65535.
errors.PORT_IO_IDENTICAL: You cannot use the same port for the sending and receiving port when the hosts for sending and receiving are the same.

all.description: Disabling each of these features will stop OyasumiVR from listening for OSC messages
all.title: Enable all features

expressionMenu.description: Control OyasumiVR features from your VRChat avatar's expression menu
expressionMenu.title: Enable VRChat expression menu control

receivingHost.description:
The host OyasumiVR will listen for OSC messages on.
(VRChat sends to 127.0.0.1 by default)
receivingHost.title: Receiving Host

receivingPort.description:
The port number OyasumiVR will listen for OSC messages on.
(VRChat sends to port 9001 by default)
receivingPort.title: Receiving Port

sendingHost.description:
The host OyasumiVR will send OSC messages to.
(If VRChat runs on the same machine, this is 127.0.0.1)
sendingHost.title: Sending Host

sendingPort.description:
The port number OyasumiVR will send OSC messages to.
(VRChat listens on port 9000 by default)
sendingPort.title: Sending Port

OSC.title: OSC Settings

misc.vrcLoginRequired: This feature requires you to be logged in with a VRChat account.

confirm-modal.message: Are you sure you want to activate the shutdown sequence right now?
confirm-modal.title: Are you sure?

shutdown-automations.description: If enjoy falling asleep in VR, but don't want to sleep in VR for the entire night, you can use OyasumiVR's shutdown sequence. This feature automatically shuts down gracefully once you've dozed off, so that you can smoothly continue your sleep outside of VR.
shutdown-automations.noOptionsSelected: As you have no actions selected to run during the shutdown sequence, running it will have no effects. In order for this feature to do something, choose at least one of the options below.

powerDownWindows.description: Attempts to power down your computer
powerDownWindows.shutdownMessage: OyasumiVR is shutting down your PC
powerDownWindows.title: Power down Windows

conflict.description: You have configured OyasumiVR to quit immediately when SteamVR is stopped. Because of this, any subsequent automations might not run. To fix this, either disable this task, or configure OyasumiVR to not quit immediately when SteamVR is stopped, in the general settings.
conflict.title: Warning: Running this task will cause OyasumiVR to quit immediately

quitSteamVR.description: This should also quit any game or overlay you have running
quitSteamVR.title: Quit SteamVR

turnOffBaseStations.description: Turns off any base stations that are still active
turnOffBaseStations.title: Turn off base stations

shutdown-automations.title: Shutdown Sequence

whenAsleep.description: Activate the shutdown sequence when sleep mode has been activated for a certain amount of time
whenAsleep.title: Activate when I am asleep

whenAsleepDuration.description: How long sleep mode should be active before the shutdown sequence runs
whenAsleepDuration.title: Sleep duration

whenAsleepTimeWindow.description: Only allow shutdown to trigger between certain hours of day
whenAsleepTimeWindow.title: Activation Window

disableAutomations.description: Automatically disable sleep mode based on various triggers
disableAutomations.onDevicePowerOn: When a device is turned on
disableAutomations.title: Disabling sleep mode

enableAutomations.atBatteryPercentage: When a device's battery percentage falls below {value}%
enableAutomations.description: Automatically enable sleep mode based on various triggers

batteryLevelAutomationConflict.description: You have set up controllers to automatically turn off when their battery level falls below a certain percentage. This might cause you to accidentally enable the sleep mode, which might not be what you want. To prevent this, you can turn off this behaviour in the "Controllers & Trackers" section of the Power Automation settings.
batteryLevelAutomationConflict.title: Warning: This might be triggered by another automation!

onControllersPoweredOff.title: When all controllers are turned off

onHeartRateCalmPeriod.title: When my heart rate is calm for a period of time

onMotionDetection.title: When OyasumiVR detects you are asleep based on your movement

enableAutomations.title: Enabling sleep mode

sleep-detection.experimentalAutomation: This automation is experimental and may not yet be reliable.

disableAtTime.description: Disable sleep mode at a specific time of day.
disableAtTime.title: Disable sleep mode

errors.thresholdNotInteger: The percentage value has to be a whole number.
errors.thresholdOutOfRange: The percentage has to be between 0% and 100%.

enableAtTime.description: Enable sleep mode at a specific time of day.
enableAtTime.title: Enable sleep mode

calibration.description: You need to calibrate at least once before you should try to use this feature.
calibration.title: Calibration

enableForSleepDetector.description: With this feature enabled, OyasumiVR will automatically enable sleep mode when it guesses you're asleep based on your movement.

detectionWindow.description: How long OyasumiVR should wait before it detects you being asleep
detectionWindow.title: Detection window

sensitivity.description: The higher the sensitivity, the more likely that OyasumiVR will detect you being asleep.
sensitivity.title: Sensitivity

sleepCheck.description: Sends you an actionable notification to ask if you are still awake before enabling sleep mode.
sleepCheck.title: Before enabling sleep mode, ask if I am still awake

timeWindow.description: Only allow sleep detection to activate the sleep mode between certain hours of day
timeWindow.title: Activation Window

enableForSleepDetector.title: Enable sleep mode

bpm.description: The beats per minute your heart has to stay under for the sleep mode to be enabled.
bpm.title: BPM Threshold

enableOnHeartRateCalmPeriod.description: Enable sleep mode when your heart rate is under a certain threshold for a period of time: Define the beats per minute threshold that your heart rate has to stay under, as well as for what amount of time, for the sleep mode to be enabled. This requires you to enable the Pulsoid integration and to have an active Pulsoid "BRO" subscription.

duration.description: How long your heart rate has to stay under the threshold for the sleep mode to be enabled.
duration.title: Duration

enableOnHeartRateCalmPeriod.notEnoughData: Not enough data available to show your heart rate history.
enableOnHeartRateCalmPeriod.title: Enable sleep mode

viewHistory.description: View your heart rate history from the last 12 hours
viewHistory.title: Heart Rate History

countdown.note:
Keep still while calibrating! Pretend you are asleep.
Moving while calibrating will prevent this feature from working correctly.

done.note: You can now use this automation.

failed.note: Calibration could not complete successfully, likely due to your headset not reporting any data. Please make sure your headset is tracking and try again.

info.intro: OyasumiVR can detect if you've fallen asleep based on the movement of your VR headset. For it to be able to do this, it has to be calibrated to your VR setup. You need to calibrate at least once before you should try to use this feature.

step.one: You put on your headset and lie down.
step.two: You start the calibration in OyasumiVR from your overlay.

info.stepSuffix: That's it! After calibration, OyasumiVR should be able to detect if you've fallen asleep based on the movement of your VR headset.

sleepDetectorCalibration.noSteamVR: You can only start calibration once SteamVR is running with your VR Headset plugged in.

prepare.instruction: Put on your VR headset and lie down.
prepare.note: Once you're ready and you can see this window from your overlay, press 'Start Calibration' to get started.

sleepDetectorCalibration.title: Calibrate Sleep Detection

sleep-detection.title: Sleep Detection

status-automations.behaviourWarning: Status changes by OyasumiVR are not visible to the player. Even to other players, it can take a bit of time for a status update to show. This is a limitation of the VRChat and cannot be fixed by OyasumiVR.
status-automations.behaviourWarningFAQ:
Here you can find the answers to some questions you might have about the status change behaviour:

Q: Can I still automatically accept invite requests, even if VRChat does not show that I am on blue?
A: If you have OyasumiVR set your status to blue (join me), it will take over the responsibility of automatically accepting any invite requests you receive.

Q: People cannot join me because my status does not update for them.
A: Status updates can take a while to be shown to other users. If they want to join you but can't, they can force your status to refresh by opening your profile in the main menu.
status-automations.description:
OyasumiVR can limit the amount of people who join you, by automatically setting your status
      based on how many players there are in your world.
status-automations.disableToEdit: Please disable status automations before you make any changes.
status-automations.exampleUse:
Example use: When someone joins you, automatically switch your status to orange or red!
When they leave and you are alone again, automatically switch your status back to blue so someone else can join you.
status-automations.onlyIfSleepModeEnabled: Only when sleep mode is enabled
status-automations.playerLimitLabel: {count, plural, one {1 player} other {# players}} (including you)
status-automations.title: Status Automations

binding.description: Configure which controller button(s) should be used to control your microphone's mute state.
binding.title: Button binding

controllerBinding.conflictWarning: If you're using this feature to toggle your microphone mute with VRChat, it is recommended that in VRChat's settings you either unbind your mute button or set your microphone mode to "Always On" to prevent any conflicting behaviour.

currentMode.description: Reflects the current mode of the controller button
currentMode.title: Active button behaviour

controllerBinding.description: Bind a controller button to control the mute state of your microphone.

enabled.description: Whether to enable controller binding for toggling the mute state of your microphone

mode.description: How pressing the button should change your microphone state by default

volume.description: The volume of the sound effects that play when the microphone is muted or unmuted

systemMicMuteAutomations.description: Automatically mute or unmute your microphone on the device level when you fall asleep, or wake up! This can come in useful when you want to prevent others from hearing you snore ;)

overlayIndicator.description: Show an indicator in VR when your microphone is muted.

enabled.description: Whether to show a mute indicator in VR

fade.description: Fade out the indicator after a few seconds. You can show the indicator again by pressing any controller button. This is recommended for VR headsets with OLED displays to reduce any risk for burn-in.
fade.title: Fade out

overlayIndicator.title: Overlay Indicator

voiceActivityMode.description: Determines in what mode voice activation (the indicator lighting up) is determined.

hardwareVoiceActivityThreshold.title: Voice activation threshold
hardwareVoiceActivityThreshold.description: Set the volume threshold at which the mic indicator should light up

onSleepPreparation.title: When I prepare to go to sleep

systemMicMuteAutomations.title: System Microphone Mute Automations

error.message: The update failed to install. Please try again later.
error.title: Update Failed

control.description: You can use this to test if microphone muting is working properly
control.title: Control microphone mute

vrchatMicMuteAutomations.description:
Automatically mute or unmute your microphone in VRChat when you fall asleep, or wake up! This can come in useful when you want to prevent others from hearing your snoring ;)

Note that in order for this to work, it requires OSC to be enabled within VRChat.

mode.description: Select which mic behaviour you're using within VRChat. Note that selecting a different behaviour than the one you're using in VRChat could cause these automations to misbehave.
mode.title: VRChat microphone behaviour

onSleepPreparation.title: When I prepare to go to sleep

status.description: Reflects your current in-game microphone state
status.title: Current VRChat microphone state

vrchatMicMuteAutomations.title: Microphone Muting

nightmare-detection.title: Nightmare Detection
nightmare-detection.description: When any of its automations are enabled, this feature attempts to detect when you are having a nightmare by checking for a prolonged elevated heart rate while you are asleep. When a possible nightmare is detected, you have the option of having OyasumiVR try to wake you up. Nightmare detection only runs while the sleep mode is active. Note: This feature requires you to enable the Pulsoid integration and to have an active Pulsoid "BRO" subscription.

bpmThreshold.title: Minimum heart rate
bpmThreshold.description: The threshold your heart rate has to reach for OyasumiVR to consider the possibility of you having a nightmare

duration.title: Duration
duration.description: How long your heart rate has to stay above the threshold before OyasumiVR will trigger its nightmare detection

automations.title: Automations
automations.description: Automations to run when OyasumiVR detects you possibly having a nightmare

disableSleepMode.title: Disable sleep mode
disableSleepMode.description: Disables the sleep mode when you're possibly having a nightmare

playSound.title: Play a sound
playSound.description: Have OyasumiVR wake you up with a sound when you're possibly having a nightmare

volume.title: Sound volume
volume.description: Configure the volume at which the sound effect plays

nightmare-detection.notification: Detecting a possible nightmare, as you've had a prolonged elevated heart rate.
